document.discussion_title: Twitter’s (TWTR) “Hold” Rating Reiterated at RBC Capital
document.topic_text: Tweet Twitter Inc (NYSE:TWTR) ‘s stock had its “hold” rating reissued by stock analysts at RBC Capital in a research report issued to clients and investors on Monday, Market Beat Ratings reports. In other Twitter news, CTO Adam Messinger sold 17,077 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction on Tuesday, February 23rd. The shares were sold at an average price of $18.63, for a total value of $318,144.51. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this link . Also, CFO Anthony Noto acquired 15,500 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Tuesday, February 16th. The stock was bought at an average price of $16.08 per share, with a total value of $249,240.00. The disclosure for this purchase can be found here . TWTR has been the topic of several other reports. Robert W. Baird reiterated a “neutral” rating and issued a $18.00 price target on shares of Twitter in a report on Saturday. Pacific Crest reiterated a “sector perform” rating on shares of Twitter in a report on Thursday. Wedbush reiterated a “hold” rating and issued a $20.00 price target on shares of Twitter in a report on Wednesday, April 20th. SunTrust reiterated a “buy” rating and issued a $20.00 price target on shares of Twitter in a report on Monday, April 18th. Finally, Axiom Securities reiterated a “buy” rating and issued a $24.00 price target on shares of Twitter in a report on Thursday, April 14th. Four analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, twenty-six have given a hold rating, sixteen have issued a buy rating and two have given a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. Twitter has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $25.95. Twitter ( NYSE:TWTR ) traded down 1.6837% on Monday, hitting $16.9399. The stock had a trading volume of 13,080,744 shares. The company has a 50-day moving average price of $16.99 and a 200-day moving average price of $21.52. The stock’s market capitalization is $11.54 billion. Twitter has a 1-year low of $13.91 and a 1-year high of $52.54. Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, February 10th. The social networking company reported $0.16 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $0.12 by $0.04. The company earned $710.47 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $709.94 million. Twitter’s revenue for the quarter was up 48.3% on a year-over-year basis. During the same period in the previous year, the business earned $0.12 earnings per share. Equities analysts predict that Twitter will post $0.55 earnings per share for the current year. Other institutional investors recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Mackay Shields bought a new position in Twitter during the fourth quarter valued at about $15,077,000. Clearbridge Investments LLC increased its position in Twitter by 88.9% in the fourth quarter. Clearbridge Investments LLC now owns 14,380,330 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $332,761,000 after buying an additional 6,768,297 shares in the last quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. increased its position in Twitter by 0.4% in the fourth quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 9,030,014 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $208,955,000 after buying an additional 32,754 shares in the last quarter. Verde Servico Internacionais bought a new position in Twitter during the fourth quarter valued at about $626,070,000. Finally, Wellcome Trust increased its position in Twitter by 0.8% in the fourth quarter. Wellcome Trust now owns 7,000,000 shares of the social networking company’s stock valued at $161,980,000 after buying an additional 55,134 shares in the last quarter. Twitter, Inc ( NYSE:TWTR ) is a global platform for public self-expression and conversation in real time. The Company offers products and services for users, advertisers, developers and platform and data partners. Products and services for users enables a way for people to create, distribute and discover content, which enables a user on Twitter to create a tweet and a user to follow other users. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/twitters-twtr-hold-rating-reiterated-at-rbc-capital/ Twitter Inc Twitter Inc
